00009 using analysis::analysis_port;

00012 using tlm_core::tlm_fifo;
00013 using tlm_core::tlm_tag;

00016 template< typename T >
00017 class tlm_internal_annotated_fifo :
00018 public tlm_fifo<T> ,
00019   public virtual analysis_if<T> ,
00020   public virtual analysis_if< tlm_tag< T > * > {
00021 
00022  public:
00023   typedef tlm_tag<T> *my_tag_ptr;
00024 
00025   tlm_internal_annotated_fifo( const char *nm , int size ) :
00026     tlm_fifo<T>( nm , size ) {}
00027 
00028   void write( const T &t ) {
00029     assert( nb_can_put( (my_tag_ptr)0 ) );
00030     nb_put( t );
00031   }
00032 
00033   void write( const my_tag_ptr & ) {
00034     read_event( (my_tag_ptr)0 ).notify( SC_ZERO_TIME );
00035   }
00036 
00037 };
00038 
00039 //
00040 // From the put point of view, delayed puts are immediate. The transaction T is
00041 // considered to be in the fifo from the time at which nb_put( T , t ) was
00042 // called.
00043 //
00044 // However, from the get point of view, the effect of the delayed put is not
00045 // seen until t has expired. We cannot see the new data on the get side until
00046 // time t.
00047 //
00048 // The same rules apply to a delayed get : a get( T , t ) gets T immediately,
00049 // but the put side does not see the extra space in the fifo until time t.
00050 //
00051 // In summary : put->put and get->get is immediate, but put->get and get->put
00052 // are delayed.
00053 //
00054 // Although the precise effects of put and get may vary from channel to channel
00055 // these observability rules are part of the definition of the annotated
00056 // interfaces.
00057 //
00058 
00059 template< typename T >
00060 class tlm_annotated_fifo :
00061 public sc_module ,
00062 public virtual tlm_annotated_put_if< T  > ,
00063 public virtual tlm_annotated_get_peek_if < T  > {
00064 
00065  public:
00066 
00067    tlm_annotated_fifo( sc_module_name nm , int size = 1 ) :
00068      sc_module( nm ) ,
00069      m_size( size ) ,
00070      m_fifo("internal_fifo" , size ) ,
00071      m_put_peq("put_peq") ,
00072      m_get_peq("pop_peq") {
00073 
00074      m_put_peq.ap( m_fifo );
00075      m_get_peq.ap( m_fifo );
00076 
00077   }
00078 
00079    tlm_annotated_fifo( int size = 1 ) :
00080      sc_module( sc_gen_unique_name("annotated_fifo") ) ,
00081      m_size( size ) ,
00082      m_fifo("internal_fifo" , size ) ,
00083      m_put_peq("put_peq") ,
00084      m_get_peq("pop_peq") {
00085 
00086      m_put_peq.ap( m_fifo );
00087      m_get_peq.ap( m_fifo );
00088 
00089   }
00090   // non annotated nb_can_* methods
00091 
00092   bool nb_can_put( tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00093     return m_fifo.nb_can_put( m_put_peq.size() + m_get_peq.size() + 1 );
00094   }
00095 
00096   bool nb_can_get( tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00097     return m_fifo.nb_can_get();
00098   }
00099 
00100   bool nb_can_peek( tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00101     return m_fifo.nb_can_peek();
00102   }
00103 
00104   //
00105   // annotated nb_can_* methods
00106   //
00107   // these are virtual because we may want to add some additional time based
00108   // restrictions re: what can can be put and popped when : for example, we
00109   // might want to insist that we only ever post to the end of both peqs, to
00110   // preserve the ordering of the transactions.
00111   //
00112 
00113   // nb_can_put is part of the annotated non blocking put interface
00114 
00115   virtual bool nb_can_put( const sc_time &time , tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00116     return nb_can_put();
00117   }
00118 
00119   virtual bool nb_can_get( const sc_time &time , tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00120     return nb_can_get();
00121   }
00122 
00123   // ok_to_* methods
00124 
00125   const sc_event &ok_to_put(  tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00126     return m_fifo.ok_to_put();
00127   }
00128 
00129   const sc_event &ok_to_get(  tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00130     return m_fifo.ok_to_get();
00131   }
00132 
00133   const sc_event &ok_to_peek(  tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00134     return m_fifo.ok_to_peek();
00135   }
00136 
00137   // non annotated nonblocking put, get + peek
00138 
00139   bool nb_put( const T &t ) {
00140 
00141     if( !nb_can_put() ) {
00142       return false;
00143     }
00144 
00145     assert( m_fifo.nb_can_put() );
00146     m_fifo.nb_put( t );
00147     return true;
00148 
00149   }
00150 
00151   bool nb_get( T &t ) {
00152 
00153     if( !nb_can_get() ) {
00154       return false;
00155     }
00156 
00157     assert( m_fifo.nb_can_get() );
00158     m_fifo.nb_get( t );
00159     return true;
00160 
00161   }
00162 
00163   bool nb_peek( T &t ) const {
00164     return m_fifo.nb_peek( t );
00165   }
00166 
00167   // annotated nonblocking methods
00168 
00169 
00170   bool nb_put( const T &transaction , const sc_time &time ) {
00171 
00172     if( !nb_can_put( time ) ) {
00173       return false;
00174     }
00175 
00176     m_put_peq.write( transaction , time );
00177     return true;
00178 
00179   }
00180 
00181   virtual bool nb_get( T &transaction , const sc_time &time ) {
00182     static tlm_tag<T> *t;
00183 
00184     if( !m_fifo.nb_get_no_notify( transaction ) ) {
00185       return false;
00186     }
00187 
00188     m_get_peq.write( t , time );
00189     return true;
00190 
00191   }
00192 
00193   // blocking put, get and peek
00194 
00195   void put( const T &t ) {
00196     while( !nb_put( t ) ) {
00197       wait( ok_to_put() );
00198     }
00199   }
00200 
00201   T get( tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) {
00202 
00203     T trans;
00204 
00205     while( !nb_get( trans ) ) {
00206       wait( ok_to_get() );
00207     }
00208 
00209     return trans;
00210   }
00211 
00212   T peek( tlm_tag<T> *t = 0 ) const {
00213     return m_fifo.peek();
00214   }
00215 
00216   int size() { return m_size; }
00217 
00218  private:
00219   int m_size;
00220 
00221  protected: // to allow for overriding of annotated can_put and can_get
00222 
00223   tlm_internal_annotated_fifo<T> m_fifo;
00224 
00225   tlm_peq<T> m_put_peq;
00226   tlm_peq< tlm_tag<T> *> m_get_peq;
00227 
00228 };
00229 #endif
